article.title: Sunday Talk
article.text:
Face the Facts WVIT 10 a.m.

Host: Mike Hydeck

Gov. Ned Lamont/(D) Connecticut

Mayor Justin Elicker/(D) New Haven

 Christine Stuart discusses state employees’ response to the budget 

Power & Politics News12 Saturday at 4:30 pm & 6:30/ Sunday 11:30am & 6:30pm.

Host: John Craven

Gov. Lamont’s New Budget:
  • Paul Mounds (Gov. Lamont’s chief of staff)
  • State Sen. Kevin Kelly (CT Senate GOP leader)
  • State Rep. Vin Candelora (CT House GOP leader)
Impeachment Trial Begins:
  •  John Pavia (Quinnipiac School of Law – member of Bush v Gore legal team)
  • Robert Sanders (University of New Haven)
  • Gary Rose (Sacred Heart University)
Also, we look at the push to ban discrimination of Black women for wearing their natural hair 
 

This Week in Connecticut WTNH 10:00 am

Host: Dennis House

U.S. Rep. Jahana Hayes (D) CT-5

Governor Ned Lamont (D)

Topics:   covid vaccines,  Washington developments, CT economy

Reports from:  Kent Pierce, Amber Diaz, Jodi Latina, Lisa Carberg

CT Capitol Report WTNH  10:30am

Host: Tom Dudchik

Former House Speaker Brendan Sharkey and former State Senator John McKinney:

The state budget
Legalizing marijuana
 
 

Face the State  WFSB  8:30 a.m.

Host: Susan Raff

Segment 1 – Impeachment / The Covid Crisis
U.S. Rep. John Larson / (D) Connecticut
 
Segment 2 – The Governor’s Proposed Budget
Kevin Lembo / (D) State Comptroller
 
Segment 3 – Pt 1 – Vaccines and the Religious Exemption
Segment 3 – Pt 2 – In Memoriam/Rob Kane
Part 1
  State Rep. Jonathan Steinberg / (D) 136th District &  Chair of House Public Health Committee
   State Rep. Vincent Candelora / (R) 86th District & House Republican Leader
 
Part 2
State Rep. Joe Polletta / (R) 68th District
 

 

The Real Story  Fox61  10 a.m.

Host: Jenn Bernstein

State Representative Robyn Porter and YWCA’s Christina Jackson talk about the CROWN ACT, which is a bill that targets hair discrimination in the workplace and schools.

Max Downtown and Trumbull Kitchen Co-owner Steve Abrams, Place 2 Be owner Gina Luari, and Chicago Sam’s general manager Ryan Kealey on restaurants struggling during pandemic.
